page.title: 01EAST AND WEST RUDHAM
page.content: Six large arable farms surround the villages, three owner occupied and an individual, noble estate and Pension Fund as landlords. Fields are large with sandy soils, straight, well kept, timbered hedges and characteristic marl pits. Cereals with sugar beet, rape and potatoes as breaks are main crops; some vegetables and permanent pasture, with cattle rearing and fattening, and flying flock sheep grazing by-products. Two Parish Councils, joint Church Council (west declared redundant 1979, size, repair, use), mains water, electricity, general medical care from Massingham practice, and secondary education at Fakenham serve the 800 souls. A veterinary surgeon, agricultural engineer/blacksmith, coach operator, builder and various self employed artisans and craftsmen also trade.
